title-of-article: Sony Honored as One of "World's Most Ethical Companies" in 2020 for the 2nd Consecutive Year
content:
Tokyo, Japan - Sony Corporation has been recognized by the Ethisphere Institute as one of the "2020 World's Most Ethical Companies" for the 2nd consecutive year. The US-based Ethisphere Institute researches and advances the standards of ethical business practices worldwide.

The "World's Most Ethical Companies" award honors companies who achieve outstanding results in the areas of transparency, integrity, ethics, and compliance. Companies are evaluated across five categories: Ethics and Compliance Program, Corporate Citizenship and Responsibility, Culture of Ethics, Governance, Leadership and Reputation. This year's list includes 132 companies from across 21 countries and regions.

Sony established its "Sony Group Code of Conduct" around the core principles of fairness, integrity, honesty, respect, and responsibility, and Sony Group as a whole endeavors to uphold these principles while creating innovation. Sony is proactively engaging with stakeholders such as customers, employees, business partners, and local communities as part of its corporate direction to generate sustainable social value through its business activities.

 To Sony, this award demonstrates that its continuous efforts on ethical and responsible conduct up to this point, including promoting ethical corporate culture and implementing ethics and compliance programs, have not gone unrecognized.

Moving forward, Sony will continue to advance its initiatives in alignment with its culture of ethics and integrity.
